Posted By: Totema (1/22/2013 8:14:58 PM)

posts.post_content:
@SRSFACE. You say this card is broken. So why should it be a rare? Would it be any less broken if it were a rare or mythic rare? Would you be happier if you had to pay $20 for a copy of this, a card which is clearly competitive? If it is broken, then it shouldn't have been printed at any rarity. The power level of a card should not be determined by its rarity. The reason it sometimes IS, is so they can sell more boosters because people don't want to pay $50 for rare playsets on the secondary market.  
  
I don't think it's broken, but because it's competitive I'm glad it's not a rare. After all, the charm cycle is all uncommon. The downside to this charm is that it's not as flexible as many of the others, as the direct damage and the double strike options will be more or less the same in the decks that want to play this. This means that this charm is less flexible than, say, [Azorius Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Azorius Charm), [Izzet Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Izzet Charm), [Golgari Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Golgari Charm), ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Obviously all the whiners crying about Boros' power level haven't been playing Magic since the original Ravnica. If they had been, they would know how ridiculously gimped Boros was the first time around. Boros is very solid, but not broken good and said solidity was long since overdue.   
  
Before you start sobbing over Boros Charm being too good, at least take a second to consider how powerful ALL of the charms are, and/or take a look at some cards with the Radiance mechanic to get a sense of the karmic justice owed to Boros ;)
posts.html:
Obviously all the whiners crying about Boros' power level haven't been playing Magic since the original Ravnica. If they had been, they would know how ridiculously gimped Boros was the first time around. Boros is very solid, but not broken good and said solidity was long since overdue.

Before you start sobbing over Boros Charm being too good, at least take a second to consider how powerful ALL of the charms are, and/or take a look at some cards with the Radiance mechanic to get a sense of the karmic justice owed to Boros ;)

Posted By: Shard_Fenix (2/10/2013 4:43:50 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: In my opinion, Boros got the best charm because Red/White is the color combination that, by my experience, needs to be the most fine-tuned in order to operate. Not even operate well: just operate. They are the colors of all-out aggression, which can be easily blunted when a control or midrange deck stabilizes and no more damage will go through without massive losses for the aggro player. Boros Charm addresses two of the biggest problems aggro runs into: board wipes and life cushions. Board wipes are very strong right now with [Supreme Verdict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Supreme Verdict) and [Terminus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminus) lurking around, and the charm can't do jack against the latter. [Thragtusk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thragtusk) may not be the all-powerful gargantuan it once was, but five life and a spare body are still a big deal when an aggro deck starts to run out of steam and can't attack as safely anymore. Boros Charm gives aggro the tools it had previously lacked, and I, for one, appreciate the fact that my strategies c... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
